intro: Alysicarpus pilifer, commonly known as the hairy sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, often with a rough texture. Alysicarpus pilifer is typically found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
